From the article: Libor, which is set daily in London by 18 of the worlds largest banks, and has far-ranging influences, affecting the rates of mortgages, student loans and credit cards.
Three of those banks are American. [The American banks included in the panel surveyed by the BBA for U.S. dollar fixing are: The Bank of America, JP Morgan Chase, Citibank, NA](http://www.americablog.com/2012/07/list-of-libor-banks-involved-in-setting.html)
So the Fed has partial control and even greater influence.
